title: UDL-Based Asynchronous Online Class Design for Inclusive Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level foundational knowledge in science and proficiency in online learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners are students or job seekers with diverse academic and gender backgrounds; conducted in a BYOD environment with formative assessment-driven engagement analysis

learning_goals: Learners can explain scientific concepts with over 90% comprehension using diverse materials (text, video, simulations) based on UDL principles.
Learners can propose scientific problem-solving solutions at least three times by exchanging peer feedback on asynchronous discussion boards.
Learners can establish self-directed learning plans and achieve over 80% learning outcomes through weekly learning logs.

resources: Digital Content Library for Science Subjects

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
